meanings.definition: A person or thing that continues or follows on from a previous one.
meanings.sent1: The continuator of the story picked up where the first book left off.
meanings.sent2: The new manager acted as a continuator of the previous leader's vision.
meanings.sent3: The continuator of the marathon was a turtle wearing a cape.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the continuator of joy that filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The continuator of the melody brought tears to everyone's eyes.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that maintains the operation of a machine or system.
meanings.sent1: The backup generator served as a reliable continuator during power outages.
meanings.sent2: The thermostat acts as a continuator to ensure the room stays at a constant temperature.
meanings.sent3: The continuator of the coffee maker was a tiny robot barista.
meanings.sent4: The clock was the continuator of order in the chaotic room.
meanings.sent5: The continuator of the engine kept the car running smoothly.

meanings.definition: A musical passage that follows on from a previous one.
meanings.sent1: The continuator of the song introduced a new melody that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: In the symphony, the continuator seamlessly transitioned from one movement to the next.
meanings.sent3: The continuator of the music piece was a surprise kazoo solo.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was the continuator of the silence that enveloped the room.
meanings.sent5: The continuator of the tune lingered in the air long after the performance ended.
